column5: I just returned from trip.Vermilion Bay to Cloquet.They are working on new right of way for northbound lane between Virginia & Cook,bridge construction has just started over Rainy Lk west of Fort Frances(1 lane for a short way).502 appears to have come thru the winter in great shape.Happy travels everyone.
tv4fish, those black marks you are seeing in the road dips are from the logging trucks.
Might as well get one going. For those that travel up from I-35 to the 502. Give us all a heads up to whats happening. Good, bad, or indifferent. Thanks!
I-94 from Clearwater, MN to St.Cloud, MN down to 1 lane both ways from now Until July 1st due to resurfacing. Expect SIGNIFICANT backups is what Channel 5 was saying on the news this morning.
http://www.dot.state.mn.us/construction/2013/statewideprojectlist.pdfThis will take you to planned statewide road work.
http://www.dot.state.mn.us/construct...rojectlist.pdfSorry about that. I had an extra space in the link.
Here is a site (with map) that shows road construction in Ontario,Canada:http://www.mto.gov.on.ca/english/tra...trip/map.shtml Regards,Snowball
Anybody else find it "interesting" that they don't even label 502?72 IS labeled.
I checked the boxes for current and also for future projects, and couldn't really find anything in Ontario. I suppose now that the 502 is done, we're all good for another 20.

So true What I find very interesting is all of the black marks in the center of the traffic lanes at the major "dips" on 502 --- there has to be a lot of flat "dolly wheels" on boat trailer tongues up in Canada.
